string.name: t
string.br: Thyroid is an Autoimmune Disease. It affects the Thyroid gland, which is located in the neck.
The thyroid secretes several hormones, collectively called as Thyroid hormones. By checking the level of these hormones, one can say if they are suffering from this disorder or not.

br.b: There are basically two kinds of this disorder.

resources.string:
It is also known as Underactive Thyroid as it produces less hormones than the normal. 
 The main Cause is Iodine Deficiency. 
 Its Symptoms Include: 
 -Weight Gain
 -Constipation
 -Myxedema (swelling on face or eyebrows)
 -Low Heart Rate
 -High Blood Pressure
 -Change in Skin color - Pale yellow
 -Dry skin
 -Intolerance to Cold
 -In females - Infertility

In youngsters having very low production of the hormones, these symptoms can be seen: 
 -Cretinism
 -Slow Reflexes

It is also known as Overactive Thyroid as it produces more hormones than the normal. 
 Its Symptoms Include: 
 -Weight Loss
 -Diarrhoea
 -High Heart Rate
 -High Blood Pressure
 -Palpitation
 -Excessive Sweating
 -Intolerance to Heat
 -Exophthalmos
In people with Heart condition, their heart condition keeps getting worse. \n
